author: The Acorn Staff
title: Their choice for LVUSD is Lazar
text:
I am pleased to offer my strong support for Alan Lazar’s candidacy for the LVUSD Board of Education.
As a dedicated parent with children currently in our schools, Alan understands firsthand the challenges students face today. He will bring a vital, fresh perspective to the board and serve as a passionate advocate for our children’s success.
Alan’s past experience supporting our schools and his commitment to being a strong voice for parents is undeniable, and I know he will work tirelessly to represent the needs of our community.
One area where Alan and I are particularly closely aligned is the critical issue of limiting cellphone distractions during the school day. He will be a powerful advocate for new policies that help our students stay focused on their education and well-being.
Alan recognizes that tackling the dangerous effects of social media and unfettered cellphone access during the school day is key to improving both the academic performance and the mental health of our students.
Alan Lazar’s dedication to fostering a productive learning environment while addressing the social and emotional needs of our students makes him the right choice for our community.
I urge everyone to vote for Alan—he will be a dedicated and effective advocate for students, parents, and educators.
Dallas Lawrence
Calabasas
Dallas Lawrence is vice president of the Las Virgenes Unified School District Board of Education.
I am writing to endorse Alan Lazar for the LVUSD School Board election this November.
I have had the pleasure of knowing Alan and his family for many years now, and I can confidently say he possesses the outstanding qualities and skills to excel in this position. Alan’s dedication to LVUSD is clear.
Our kids have grown up together and during that time, very few parents have been as involved and dedicated to improving LVUSD as Alan. I have also had the opportunity to interact with Alan in the business world and I can confidently say that Alan’s ethical standards are solid and unshakable.
As a citizen of Calabasas, a parent of three current LVUSD students, and as a former LVUSD student myself, I believe that it is important to elect leaders who are committed to improving our community.
Alan has demonstrated his commitment to public service and community volunteering, and also sits on several industry boards, as a successful businessman.
It’s understandable why all four mayors in our school district have endorsed Alan, along with 12 other City Council members.
The most important thing for me is that my kids have the best academic opportunities available to them, and a well-rounded education without ideology of any sort.
I strongly urge you to vote for Alan Lazar in the upcoming election. I am confident that he will make a positive impact for our schools and our children as an LVUSD School Board member.
Daniel Schwartz
Calabasas

author: GB Times
title: How to block YouTube ads on YouTube app?
text:
How to Block YouTube Ads on YouTube App?
Are you tired of watching ads on YouTube and wanting to get rid of them? You’re not alone! Many users are looking for ways to block YouTube ads on the YouTube app. In this article, we’ll show you how to do just that.
Method 1: Using Ad Blockers
One of the most effective ways to block YouTube ads is by using ad blockers. Ad blockers are software that blocks ads from appearing on websites and apps, including YouTube. Here are some popular ad blockers you can use:
uBlock Origin : A popular ad blocker that is available for both desktop and mobile devices.
AdBlock Plus : Another popular ad blocker that is available for both desktop and mobile devices.
AdGuard : A powerful ad blocker that is available for both desktop and mobile devices.
To use an ad blocker on YouTube, follow these steps:
Download and install the ad blocker of your choice.
Open the YouTube app and navigate to the video you want to watch.
Tap the three vertical dots on the top right corner of the screen.
Tap "Settings" and then "Site settings".
Scroll down to the "Advertising" section and toggle on "Block ads".
Restart the YouTube app and you should no longer see ads.
Method 2: Using YouTube’s Built-in Ad Blocker
YouTube has a built-in ad blocker that you can use to block ads. Here’s how:
Open the YouTube app and navigate to the video you want to watch.
Tap the three vertical dots on the top right corner of the screen.
Tap "Settings" and then "Site settings".
Scroll down to the "Advertising" section and toggle on "Block ads".
Restart the YouTube app and you should no longer see ads.
Method 3: Using a VPN
Another way to block YouTube ads is by using a VPN (Virtual Private Network). A VPN can help you block ads by changing your IP address and making it look like you’re accessing YouTube from a different location. Here’s how:
Download and install a VPN app on your device.
Open the VPN app and connect to a server in a country where YouTube ads are blocked.
Open the YouTube app and navigate to the video you want to watch.
You should no longer see ads.
Method 4: Using a Browser Extension
If you’re using a browser to access YouTube, you can use a browser extension to block ads. Here are some popular browser extensions you can use:
uBlock Origin : A popular ad blocker that is available for both Chrome and Firefox.
AdBlock Plus : Another popular ad blocker that is available for both Chrome and Firefox.
AdGuard : A powerful ad blocker that is available for both Chrome and Firefox.
To use a browser extension to block YouTube ads, follow these steps:
Download and install the browser extension of your choice.
Open the YouTube website in your browser.
Click the extension icon in the top right corner of the browser window.
Click "Block ads" and you should no longer see ads.
Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Are ad blockers illegal?
A: No, ad blockers are not illegal. However, some websites may not work properly if you’re using an ad blocker.
Q: Will ad blockers slow down my internet speed?
A: No, ad blockers should not slow down your internet speed. However, if you’re using a VPN, it may slow down your internet speed.
Q: Can I use ad blockers on all websites?
A: Yes, ad blockers can be used on all websites, not just YouTube.
Q: Are there any free ad blockers available?
A: Yes, there are many free ad blockers available. However, some ad blockers may have limitations or require you to pay for premium features.
Q: Can I use ad blockers on my mobile device?
A: Yes, ad blockers are available for both desktop and mobile devices.
Q: Will ad blockers block all ads?
A: No, ad blockers may not block all ads. Some ads may be able to bypass ad blockers.
Q: Can I use ad blockers on YouTube Premium?
A: Yes, ad blockers can be used on YouTube Premium. However, you may need to use a VPN to block ads on YouTube Premium.
Q: Are ad blockers safe to use?
A: Yes, ad blockers are generally safe to use. However, it’s always a good idea to be cautious when downloading and installing software.
Conclusion
Blocking YouTube ads is a simple process that can be done using ad blockers, YouTube’s built-in ad blocker, a VPN, or a browser extension. By following the methods outlined in this article, you can enjoy ad-free YouTube videos. Remember to always be cautious when downloading and installing software, and to check the terms of service of any ad blocker you use.

author: Natalie Clydesdale/KFOR
title: Oklahomans step in to help after Ohio barn fire
text: OKLAHOMA CITY ( [KFOR](http://kfor.com)) – The National Reining Horse Association is a close knit circle. “You’re competing against one another,” said Brandon Brant of Belle Center, Ohio. “But then something like this happens. It’s unbelievable how everybody’s pulled together.” When tragedy struck at Brant’s barn, about an hour north of Columbus, the news quickly made its way to Oklahoma. “The first 911 call went in at 12:15 Ohio time, which was 11:15 here. By 12:00 here, this place was as somber as you’ve ever seen,” said Sean Johnson, a horse trainer from Tulsa and Brant’s best friend. Earlier this month, flames engulfed Brant’s 60,000 square-foot barn. The fire sent one man, Eric Priest, to the ICU and killed 44 horses. “The flick of a finger and it’s gone,” said Brant. “It’s awful. It is the worst thing I’ve ever experienced and like I said, I wouldn’t wish it on anybody. I mean, this is one of the biggest tragedies in our industry.” Perhaps unsurprisingly Oklahomans and others all around the world have stepped up to help Brant, Priest and their customers get back in the saddle. Over the last week or so, hundreds of donations have been piling up at the NRHA Derby in Oklahoma City. “This generosity is huge,” said Johnson. “These people, they’ve lost everything.They lost all their equipment, their help, right down to their clothes. I mean, they lost their hopes and dreams.” The donated items will be auctioned off next week June 24 through June 26. “It’s unbelievable. The immense support from Oklahoma City, the NRHA,” said Brant. “I can never thank everybody. I could try but it’s just so immense.” More information about the efforts to help Brant, Priest and their customers can be found [here](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fprofile.php%3Fid%3D61560795390393&data=05%7C02%7CCaroline.Sellers%40kfor.com%7C73af681114b94c0b986608dc9208a48d%7C9e5488e2e83844f6886cc7608242767e%7C0%7C0%7C638545813013886996%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MejAA6pPrI%2B9LatPybJfx98E69qIdrFq9uDZZEVsWnU%3D&reserved=0). A link to the auction is [here](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Finternethorseauctions.com%2Fauction-ptb.php%3Faucid%3D543&data=05%7C02%7CCaroline.Sellers%40kfor.com%7C73af681114b94c0b986608dc9208a48d%7C9e5488e2e83844f6886cc7608242767e%7C0%7C0%7C638545813013907949%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kW2yxzeaaaxL9EieQ%2FgGFYLO3dMvGQyJAcY8CXj4O%2BE%3D&reserved=0).
